channel.title: AI Agents on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in AI Agents on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: security: The new Microsoft Security Store unites partners and innovation
item.description:
Microsoft announced the new Microsoft Security Store, a centralized gateway that helps customers discover, purchase, and deploy vetted security solutions and AI agents from leading partners, aiming to simplify procurement and accelerate partner-driven innovation.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: dotnet: Introducing Microsoft Agent Framework (Preview): Making AI Agents Simple for Every Developer
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Microsoft Agent Framework (Preview), a unified solution for creating, orchestrating, hosting, and observing AI agents in the .NET ecosystem to help developers ship production AI agents faster.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: ai: Introducing Microsoft Agent Framework: The Open-Source Engine for Agentic AI Apps
item.description:
Microsoft announced the open-source Microsoft Agent Framework, an engine designed for building agentic AI applications. The framework addresses the evolving needs of AI agents — which go beyond chatbots and copilots — by enabling autonomous components that can reason about goals, call tools and APIs, collaborate with other agents, and adapt dynamically. The announcement appeared on the Azure AI Foundry Blog.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: security: Introducing Microsoft Marketplace — Thousands of solutions. Millions of customers. One Marketplace.
item.description:
Microsoft announced the launch of the reimagined Microsoft Marketplace, a unified and trusted destination for cloud solutions, AI apps and agents designed to connect thousands of solutions with millions of customers and empower organizations to become ‘Frontier’.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: GitHub MCP Registry: The fastest way To discover AI tools
item.description:
GitHub announced the MCP Registry, a centralized place to discover MCP servers and AI tools so developers can more quickly find and connect AI agents to their development workflows. The registry aims to replace hunting through multiple registries, repositories, and community threads with a single searchable catalog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Expanded support for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) in Azure API Management
item.description:
Azure API Management is in public preview with expanded support for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), adding MCP support in v2 SKUs and the ability to expose existing MCP-compliant servers to simplify connecting APIs and AI agents.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Start and track Copilot coding agent tasks from Raycast
item.description:
Raycast, a macOS launcher, now supports interaction with AI agents, including starting and tracking GitHub Copilot coding agent tasks.

  • Source: GitHub
